definition: long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
garment/jacket with open slits in place of sleeves

sentences.english: She chose the most splendid gown she had, and took out her jewels.
sentences.chinese: 她从衣饰中选出最华丽的一件长衫，取出她的珠宝。

sentences.english: A generation ago, Chinese people had empty pockets in their dreary boiler suits.
sentences.chinese: 上一代人以前，中国人穿的单调的长衫口袋空空。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji was the only long-gowned drinker who took his wine standing up.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿长衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: He wears a Chinese-style robe and his hands are crossed on his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他身着长衫，两手在胸前交叉。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji was the only one who stood drinking while wearing a robe.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿长衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Although he wore a long gown, it was dirty and damaged;
sentences.chinese: 穿的虽然是长衫，可是又脏又破。

sentences.english: Kong was the only long-gowned customer to drink his wine standing.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿长衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji was the only standing drinker who wore long robes.
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己是站著喝酒而穿长衫的唯一的人。

sentences.english: Chinese people wear a long gown and pants.

definition: everyday robe worn at home in ancient times/robe worn by priests, monks and scholars
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
black (without gloss)/black with a hint of red in it
